original:
Decomposers play a crucial role in ecosystems by influencing the quantity of plant and microbial biomass present. They break down dead organic matter, releasing carbon back into the atmosphere and facilitating nutrient cycling. This process converts nutrients stored in dead biomass into forms that can be readily utilized by plants and other microbes.


A population is defined as a group of organisms of the same species that inhabit a sp
